title: After C9 Balls' Pentakill
body:
The EU tears hitting the floor was music to my ears. You finally got what was coming to you.

 NA > EU NOW

replies.body: The "NA>EU" spam is annoying, go away. C9 was playing sub par and ended with luck.

sure
but when euw says EU>NA it's perfectly acceptable
why can't people lose with grace and honor

> [{quoted}](name=2000boxes,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=i4mr1O6t,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-10-04T17:00:21.815+0000)
>
> sure
> but when euw says EU>NA it's perfectly acceptable
> why can't people lose with grace and honor

Seriously, When I watch the Twitch chat, I barely see anyone spamming "EU>NA" but the "NA>EU" spam never leaves the chat no matter how fast it moves.

that still doesn't prove my statement wrong
you guys are perfectly fine with people saying EU>NA, but you aren't ok with NA>EU
if you don't do it as much that doesn't mean it's any better than what we are doing.

We guys are not perfectly fine with that, we are just saying that NA seems to be more arrogant when it comes to this. 
Next time check EU LCS, all you will see when something is done badly will be: "EU flash, EU this, EU that".

Now you act like you are the victims while both EU and NA have those idiots to an extent. You just see the "EU>NA" spam because you are sensible to this, you completely ignore the "NA>EU" spam too.

Are you implying that "NA flash" and "NA ult" aren't used to describe a bad play in every region including EU, if so your clearly pretending you don't notice that.

Also the whole EU vs NA thing started because of EU with all the trash talk they have done since the start of competitive LoL. EU has definitely been the more arrogant region, and every time EU wins something significant it all just "fun and games" but god forbid they loose and here come the people like you with this "do we really need to resort to this, why cant we get along" attitude. 

Face it there is a healthy rivalry in place between EU and NA, stop being so sensitive when ever y'all drop the ball acting like this is the same way you act when y'all come on top.

I did not say NA>Eu spam was acceptable either
i just said you didn't see anything wrong when EU>NA spam pops
IMO both are annoying and it doesn't matter because it's most likely some team from asia that will win worlds

Are you kidding me? Twitch chat is full EU people spamming, "EU > NA", "FAT AMERICANS", etc. 

Riot should either moderate or remove the chat completely if they want anyone to take their "eSport" seriously. If someone tuned in and didn't know what was going on and saw the chat they'd immediately think it's just some child's game and not worth their time.

Check for Xemerons reply.
That's literally what happens. To 1 "EU>NA" comes 10 "NA>EU". I don't use the chat and don't care what happens there mostly, all that fighting over NA being better than EU or the other way around is annoying anyway.
I made this post for the fact that EU was the one that started it. Making jokes about NA being awful, NA flash, NA this, NA that. it started off as EU > NA.

Don't act like you guys aren't doing that either. All i see during EU LCS is americans spamming EU flash, EU flash, EU this and EU that.
It's on both sides, nobody actually started this. People like you do because you think you are the ones that know the other part started it (and we have idiots like that on EU too)

I don't use twitch chat at all, nor would I ever want to be apart of that cesspool. But from what I see it's never NA > EU. Maybe there are a couple but never more than EU > NA. I just found it funny how everyone was shit talking C9 and NA during that game, and then the entirety of EU fell silent in chat after the obliteration of FNC. 

And calling their win luck? No no no no no... Darius isn't that OP, especially in pro level play. (He's even being nerfed more). He did so well because they build an entire team around Darius. If it wasn't for their strategies and careful play none of those picks would've mattered. He's kited easily and only OP in Soloque.

Yes, they built a team around Darius (which in itself is questionable, building a team around a toplaner should not happen and Riot needs to fix that asap).

I will be honest, I placed C9 last in group for my Pick-Em challenge, because they looked way worse than they play now. The only thing that keeps me from supporting them is their boring playstyle. Tower siege for 30 mins, don't do teamfights and maybe push an inhib without the enemy team being able to react to it. Yes, it brings them wins, but it's boring as hell to watch.
Why shouldn't a team be built around a top laner? I didn't realise playing a team comp around a carry top laner should be against the rules.

> [{quoted}](name=Mat7itan,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=i4mr1O6t,comment-id=000000020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-04T17:56:46.703+0000)
>
> Why shouldn't a team be built around a top laner? I didn't realise playing a team comp around a carry top laner should be against the rules.

You dont huild a team around Darius. Thats what all the other teams made wrong. 
You build a strong 4 man team, then you pick Darius.
With only 5 Champions, the enemy team can either stop Darius OR stop the 4 man team, but not both.

I think that if worlds has shown us anything it is that building a team around Darius is one of the only ways you can get Darius to work on the pro level. Its obvious that Darius, despite how often he has been picked, has so far not been the best pick at Worlds. He has been on the losing side for a lot of the matches and even when his team wins he still hasn't made a huge impact.

The mistake that the teams first picking Darius made, and the casters mentioned this constantly, was that once they picked him they gave him no priority in the match. Nothing was done to ensure that the top laner could succeed. A lot of players have been able to shut him down. So it seems odd to bash the team that finally showed why Darius keeps getting first picked.  And who is saying that C9 didn't build a strong four man team? They got Azir, Lee Sin, Tristana, and Morgana, all of those picks look pretty good if you ask me.

> [{quoted}](name=MadKnife IV,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=i4mr1O6t,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2015-10-04T17:04:32.501+0000)
>
> Don't act like you guys aren't doing that either. All i see during EU LCS is americans spamming EU flash, EU flash, EU this and EU that.
> It's on both sides, nobody actually started this. People like you do because you think you are the ones that know the other part started it (and we have idiots like that on EU too)

Give up, you won't win against american arrogance. But at least our food isn't garbage.
The "EU>NA" is just as annoying and pathetic, and I'm pretty sure they didn't win because of luck. They won because they played better than fnatic in the end.

*Checks EU LCS*
Chat: EU flash, EU this, EU that, NA>EU
I don't approve of NA>EU any more than I do of EU>NA, but I do have to ask... Apart from RNG crits, what part of a programmed game could have possibly been "luck"?

> [{quoted}](name=MadKnife IV,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=i4mr1O6t,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-04T16:58:06.931+0000)
>
> The "NA>EU" spam is annoying, go away. C9 was playing sub par and ended with luck.

And by luck you mean Darius

EU= Mr. Garrison
 C9 Balls=Cartman Balls....
Love how all the EU guys are crying "omg darius OP only reason they won" lol.

like there had better be a replay in a highlight reel somewhere.
I saw darius kill like 3 ppl and then PENTAKILL
like I thought the other two got away or somethin from how fast they got away
Rekkles bleed to death while he was running to fountain. The other guy I'm pretty sure got dunked on.

Whatever, I think you deserve one win after getting slaughtered every single time in the past x) Oh wait, half of "american" team players are asians lol

And people are really sensitive about e$ports? Really? I coudl cry after losing a football match but this?
Oh, so Huni and Reignover are European? How about Ryu? Get out of here.
